text:
Saat saya menginap disini, terjadi miskomunikasi. Walaupun kami sudah melakukan online booking dan sudah confirm kamar tapi saat kami checkin kamar tersebut tidak tersedia. 
Saya sarankan untuk ricek kembali bookingan anda.
Jadi saat itu kami terpaksa mengambil suite room, karena pihak hotel menjanjikan adanya manager yang akan bicara dengan kami keesokan harinya dan mereka akan memberikan kompensasi akan kesalahan tersebut. Sayang sekali walaupun kami minta untuk bicara dengan mamagement mereka tidak melayani request kami tersebut. 

Kamarnya bagus (karena suite), lokasinya lumayan dekat dengan pantai batu bolong dan cafe yang lumayan terkenal di area tersebut yaitu Old Man dan Kaki Lima.

Menu restoran lumayan enak.

text: We stayed here as a couple for three nights as part of a two week trip in Bali. Our room type was Deluxe and we requested a high floor when booking which was accommodated. The room was large with a big balcony looking over the pool / roofs and sea beyond. Rooms are fairly basic but have everything you need. There are three set menus to choose from for breakfast all including tea, coffee and things like fruit, eggs, pancakes, bread, pastries etc. The pool area is fairly compact but clean and was rarely busy as mostly people are out and about and just using it for a dip to cool off before or after their day. The winner for us was the location, only a 5 minute walk down to the beach and set among some of the best shops / restaurants / cafes / spas Canggu has to offer.. yet still set back from the road looking out over peaceful mini rice field. Yes, there is also some construction / waste land around / visible from the hotel but it’s a developing resort so that is completely to be expected. Overall given the price, I would recommend the Kirana to any one looking for a comfortable and well located base from which to enjoy Canggu.
title: Great location, does the trick for short visit

text:
Reception and check-in was relatively fast and easy, staff very friendly and helpful. The suite I reserved through Hotels.com was beyond my expectations, quite spacious, clean and comfortable. Our suite was privately situated away from guest traffic. The included breakfast offered a wide assortment of choices from local Balinese to western options and all were excellently prepared and presented. The surrounding neighborhood offers countless dining options, vegan eateries, bars, spas and shopping just steps away and the beach is a short 10 minute stroll. The hotel's spa was one of the best we've ever experienced, be sure to ask for Nuri. She's been referred by many on Trip Advisor for good reason. The pool in front of our suite gave a calming effect even while the hotel was undergoing some renovations at the time and drilling and jackhammering could be heard during the daylight hours along with construction next door of a new structure adding to the noise. The gym was inoperable. equipment broken, missing components, generally unusable. The rooftop landing offered 360 degree views of Canggu and the ocean. It served as my early morning launchpad for my Mavic Pro.

Canggu has many ex-pats from Australia and is a young and happening little seaside town. I can definitely recommend The Kirana Hotel to friends and family and would return should my travels takes me back again one day.
title: Great Location, Friendly & Helpful Staff, Good Value

text: We booked into the Kirana because we couldnt get a room at the Aston Canggu. We were pleasantly surprised as the check in was good and the staff welcoming. We chose a deluxe ocean view which was reasonably priced and included breakfast. The room was large and well finished - good quality and the bathroom was fantastic - two basins, the only hotel to have two basins in our entire Bali trip. The view was nice - not much of an ocean view but still nice. The breakfasts were wonderful and while not buffet style the food was very good and plentiful with lots of options - well done. NOW the less than positive - the door on the balcony would not lock. The gym was closed and there was construction activity but thats ok. We asked for a DVD player in the room and were told it would be $5 a day. I reluctantly agreed because other hotels provided players for free - but at least they also supplied a heap of dvd's to watch. On check out I left my wife with the credit card and she checked out for both of us. About three hours later I got a call from the hotel at our new hotel. They informed me that they had forgotten to charge my wife for the DVD player and they would be coming down to the new hotel to ask for the money. Then they told me it was $5USD not AUD. So this made 50,000 rph about 75,000 rph. Now I know that's not much money but it was the principle. I gave them 50,000 when they eventually turned up. Not a pleasant end to the hotel stay but otherwise the hotel was good.
title: Good hotel but let down by checkout experience

This place has value for money all over it! 
Situated in the heart of where you want to be and only a few minutes/cycle to the beach. It also is surrounded by many good shops and affordable cafes with amazing food. The rooms are clean and well sized with a balcony that looks onto the pool. The best thing about this place however is the staff. They are very friendly and always trying to help you with whatever you need. 

Bicycles are also available for free and an excellent way to get around Canggu. 

Lastly, check out is a breeze with a 12pm check out and luggage storage for free. Since our flight was late in the evening they asked us would we want a shower before a flight so they opened another room for us. Airport shuttle is only 250k which is a big bonus!

If we had any requests or questions, the staff where always there to help us :)

Great location, just a couple of minutes walk to the beach, plenty of restaurants just outside the hotel area.
The rooms are modern and spacious, housekeeping is offered every day. Nice pool area! The only thing that I wasn't completely happy with, was the standard of the bathrooms. Smelly drain and tiles not being properly cleaned, but everything works with a pair of flipflops! Haha.

Keep in mind that Canggu does not have a beach for swimming. Surfing only! We did not dare to try surfing as firsttimers as the waves where too big.

I would absolutely recommend Kirana, we had a great stay!

If you are looking for a quiet  afternoon beer or Mojito and watching the surf at sunset the Sandbar is the place..we went there every afternoon.
Kirana is exremely good value for money and we highly recommend it!
Trevor & Cathy from Australia
title: Happy Days in Canggu

text: This resort is only a 5 min walk from Batu Balong Beach which is excellent for anyone who's down for surfing or hanging out at the trendy spots Old Mans and The Lawn. We originally had reservations for the Frii Echo Beach but immediately didn't like it so we switched to The Kirana. We stayed in The Penthouse and it was huge! Full sized fridge, large comfy bed, and a shower and a bathtub....plenty of room! The air conditioning is annoyingly loud in the bedroom so I hope you can sleep through lots of noise. We did so it didn't bother us. The penthouse had its own swimming pool and I have included the photo. That was amazing. Breakfast is very good. We got Mei Goreng everyday of the stay because it was so good. It comes with fried bananas which is even better! The last day of our stay, they didn't have any bananas because their supplier never came. That's the only reason I'm not giving them 5 stars. Other than that, you'll enjoy your stay here away from Kuta and Seminyak's awful Vegas like streets.
title: Excellent resort

text:
Having read all these amazing reviews and seeing the promising photos everywhere I decided to stay at one of Kirana's Deluxe rooms. Wrong choice. My experience in bullet points:

- The staff are all lovely, smiley and try their best but not trained or properly managed.  
- The location is perfect if you want to walk to Oldmans or BatuBolong beach.   
- The building needs a serious maintenance update. The walls, the floors, the wood, show signs of deterioration and no proper maintenance. 
- The rooms are not "Deluxe" in the slightest and need an urgent make over. There's humidity. A problem pervasive in Bali but in other places is kept under control. 
- The gym was an afterthought and shouldn't be called a gym. A tiny glass box that can get very hot, very outdated machines. 
- This is a budget hotel, but still I found it expensive for the experience it offers.
title: Well located, poorly managed hotel in need of an urgent make over.

text:
I chose this hotel first because of the positive reviews here on TripAdvisor and second because I saw that there is a gym, as I like to train even when on holidays. Regrettably the reality did not meet my expectations. 

Let me first start with the pros:
Like everyone said it already, location-wise, it is one of the best in Canggu, putting you close to a selection of restaurants, bars and cafes, some of them which play live bands making the area a very lively one and fun. About 5min walk you have a seemingly very popular beach amongst the surfers enthusiast and about 15-20 drive you are in Seminiake square, the shopping heaven of the area, so they say. The hotel conveniently provides a free shuttle service that goes to Seminiake three times a day but for drop-offs only. 

The staff, like most Balinese, is very friendly and ready to satisfy one's requests. The breakfast is a la carte with three choices: American, continental and Balinese. Everything else was ok. Just ok, really, for my standards and expectations. 

Now to some cons: the hotel itself is in need of some renovation work. If this is a 4 star, I would think a 3 star must be really horrible. The bathroom was a disaster. There was a bad smell coming up from the shower drain which forced us to keep the bathroom door always closed to prevent the smell from coming into the room. 

The gym was another disappointment. It should simply be closed down and never be advertised. Those machines, not only seem to be some leftovers from the 2nd world war, they can be dangerous for anyone using them, for the condition they are in. If this facility is not highly requested and thus not worthy of modernizing it, they are better off closing it down altogether than to advertiser something that is more harmful than useful. In addition, this gym can only be used from 9am and not earlier as there is a bedroom underneath the gym, which the noise might disturb patrons still sleeping at an earlier time.
title: Nothing Exceptional

text:
I booked this hotel as it seemed to be more upscale and quieter then the others along the beach and in Canggu. Boy was I wrong! At 12am a bunch of drunk guests came back to the hotel and were partying and blasting music near the pool. You could hear that the hotel tried to ask them quiet down because the music would stop for 10 minutes and then start again. This lasted until 3am

If you decide to book the hotel which is beautiful, be sure to ask for a room that does not face the pool as it seems to be a gathering place late at night. 

Not worth the money as there are many other place nearby.
title: Bring you earplugs

text:
We had really bad storms for most of the time we stayed at Kirana and this meant a poor experience. We had a room facing the sea, that then got pounded by wind and rain all night for 3 nights, doors banging in the frames, and then water actually coming in under the door into the hotel room so we put towels down as we were worried about electrics. The ceiling light above the bed then also began leaking right on my head, meaning we both had to sleep on one side of the bed to avoid being dripped on (there is no couch option). The weather is not the hotel's fault, however, it was not a good experience hence my rating of 2 out of 5.
We did ask to change rooms but the only rooms available all faced the same direction and would have the same issue so we didn't bother.
We never used the pool as all rooms face the pool (looking down on it) which meant it felt a bit weird/public.
Breakfast, we tried once then ate at local cafe's which offer a larger more enjoyable range. We never used the spa or restaurant for other meals.
Staff are friendly and pleasant enough, and it is close walking distance to the beach if you are a solid surfer.
title: Bad weather made for a unpleasant visit

Canggu is a great little town and this is a great hotel. Just keep in mind, this is not a luxury, 5 star type resort. Its safe, clean and has everything you need including wifi and cable TV. If I went back to Canggu, I'd stay there again!

Room service were quick to attend to this by changing the mattress but wiped up the bed base and floor with a towel - no disinfectant and couldn't really explain how this would have happened in the first place. Also sink blocked in bathroom and plug malfunctioned. Spa treatment decidedly average. However the staff were friendly and once we had explained our dissatisfaction we were eventually given a free massage and sincere apology (couldn't help but think that this should have been offered rather than asked for). Breakfasts were great. Pool lovely. Great location.

text: Stayed here 4 nights after seeing it one night while visiting Batu Bolong beach in the evening from our hotel in Seminyak. Canggu is definitely more chilled out and less congested than Seminyak! There's loads of restaurants within walking distance to the hotel. The hotel itself is nicely decorated and the service is great. The breakfast is of champions with choices of American, continental and Indonesian. They give you lots of food! The pool is good, although the loungers are few and are right outside people's room which might be a bit awkward in the beginning but you get used to it. Our in room safe was having issues but they fixed it very quickly! The staff are great and always ready to help with anything. Would stay here again for sure due to its location and service. Only thing is the hotel needs a bit of a revamp as the shower leaked a bit and the towels provided were a bit frayed and old. Not really a deal breaker, but just something that would make this a 5/5 from me. Good value for money!
title: Cool hotel close to the Old Man's beach

text: We loved our time at the Kirana, myself and my husband have stayed in the suite on the bottom floor with access to the swimming pool. The suite was huge , well decorated and exceptionally clean. The bed was very comfortable. The breakfast was a choice of three but it was very delicious. We dined few times as well and found the food to be delicious at a great price. The hotel is close to the beach just a few minute walk, with the beach being non touristy. The spa in the hotel was exceptional with incredibly low prices. The hotel itself is a bit out from the main Kuta/Legian area but there are shuttle buses free of charge going from the hotel. Personally i preferred the Canggu area to the real touristy Kuta area. We also took numerous tours from the hotel which were great value for money. We would defo stay here again when coming back to Bali.
title: Great holiday

text:
Close to the beach, fantastic spa, great location. What more can you ask for. We didn't really care for the food here but the location couldn't be better to eat at some incredible places in Canggu. The walk to old man beach and Echo beach was easy. We loved the pool, gym and spa here was a great way to spend a rainy day. The gym was pretty hot and the equipment wasn't the best but it was nice to have a bit of work out while away. 

Overall was excellent, rooms were comfortable and staff was friendly.
title: Little bit of Luxury

text:
My first impression, the hotel are clean, friendly and helpful staffs. My room was clean, except there are so many ants in the floor. There were also ants in breakfast table. The staffs said it was common during rainy season.

You need to allocate at least 15 minutes of your time for breakfast, as you need to order your breakfast first (not breakfast buffet). It wont take too long, like 5-8 minutes for your breakfast to be ready. Since the breakfast was good (I order egg benedict), I considered it was worth to wait for (except for the coffee which is not so good).

There are a lot of food close by the hotel and some shop for window shopping. Overall, I like this hotel.
title: Nice breakfast

text: Friendly resort near to yoga, beach and Betelnut cafe. We got a voucher for 15 minutes footmassage and enjoyed this in the spa. In the evenings we had a great view of sunsets over the sea. For breakfast we could choose between different menus and it was served at the tables. Here I can recommend the pancakes wth bananas and honey.
title: The kirana panncakes are very good!

text:
Overall the Kirana was a very clean and pleasant hotel to stay at. The restaurant food was very good and we had dinner there twice. Staff a very friendly , helpful and efficient. In terms of location, it sits roughly in the middle between beach and Canggu hub, where all the cafes and shops are.
The room was good and had everything one would need. Unfortunately the balcony was very small which only allowed for one person to sit and enjoy the sunset. 
Trying to get a sun lounger at the pool was also tricky as they are directly in front of other guest rooms and it just doesn't feel right lying in front of someones bedroom window. There is a roof terrace but unfortunately un used. It has some great views. This is where the swimming pool should have been placed.
We took one swim in the pool and I regretted it the next day. Our swim-ware were reeking of an odour I cannot describe. Clearly the pool water had not been cleaned for a long long time and after realising this, we could actually see that the colour of tiles were blue but the water was murky green. Upon this discovery we noticed there never was  a pump sound, so no circulation, cleaning and filtration. This really put us off.
A real pity.
title: small balcony & dirty pool

text: Probably the best breakfast I had while in Bali , especially enjoyed the eggs benedict. The hotel has a lovely spa for massages . Not very impressed with the pool  , not very big & not many sun lounges & the chairs that were in the sun were right outside other people's rooms & they left there belongings there so you couldn't sit anyway . There were three chairs available but they were in the shade & we're practically in the restaurant . Hotel in a good location for surfers , close to old mans . Close to some good restaurants . We did discover a public pool which was cheap & a bit like a water park . Our room looked a bit old . Mould in the bathroom & a window that looked into the bedroom from the shower with s blind that didn't cover it properly so not much privacy as I was sharing with friends . Hotel rooms needs a makeover . But the bed & pillows were really comfortable . Overall an ok hotel , they do have villas which probably would be nice .
title: Great breakie & spa

text:
Positive 
Hotel was nice and in a good location near Old Mans. Staff were friendly and the choice of breakfast was good. If you are wanting to get away from the hustle and bustle off Kuta this is the place for you. 

Negative 
The option of the shuttle bus to Seminyak was not offered when required. The use of free push bikes would have been nice if there was more than one. Friends had to cancel last minute due to health reasons and was told that they would be refund part of their money but this never happened. 
Thanks Matt
title: 1st time to Canggu

text:
Amazing hotel in a perfect location. Short walk to batu bolong beach, amazing beach with so much going on.. then another short walk to echo beach a consistent surf spot, also close walk to some really nice bars and restaurants! 
We stayed in a double room with and ocean view and it was really good. Massive comfy bed and such a clean hotel, house keeping do an excellent job daily keeping rooms clean. Included breakfast is very nice but can become a little bit repetitive as there is only a few options. 
The staff throughout the whole hotel are very friendly and helpful, and always willing to help with anything. 
All in all a great experience and would recommend to anyone, if you are looking to chill out, surf and eat great food around canggu then kirana is defiantly a good choice
title: The Kirana Hotel Resto and Spa

text:
I stayed in the suite room. The room is big with living room and big bathroom. I love their breakfast. So variety. The staffs are very attentive and friendly.
The swimming pool is too small. 
The location is within walking distance to Batu Bolong beach, nice restaurants and cafe. 
Overall, I like my stay there.
title: Nice suite room

text: A lovely neat clean and well looked after hotel . Good service and tasty Indonesian food . Very close to the beach and not so busy traffic wise . It's about 45 mins from the airport and take the airport taxi cost is 300,000 rupia .
title: A few days to chill out in Bali

text: I Would probably only give a 3* Initial impression was that from the outside this resort is aesthetically pleasing. Front desk trainee was lovely but her male superior was unfriendly and unwelcoming. I was booked in a lead in category which was basic; linen stained, bathroom door knob fallen off, towels off color, dodgy tiling, shower head corroded, underneath bed full of dust and rubbish, lumpy Mattrass. The property isn't advertised as a party hotel but in my 2 days there was quite rowdy with drunk people by the tiny pool (which all the rooms surround) and also room parties after midnight. Canggu is an amazing area and this hotel location is fantastic, I just think they need to invest some money into making it better otherwise sadly they will lose business!
title: average

text: If you like to stay far away from crowd and enjoy peaceful moments with loved ones or friends - for the price- I highly recommended this place. Stayed here two years ago so it really was a long overdue review. The people were very friendly and The villa next to it belong to Kirana too. Wish I could try it next time. Btw, the spa was very good and is very cheap for its facility and the quality of the products they used. Wish the spa/massage could start earlier... otherwise I would do it every morning.
title: Long overdue review

text:
Nice enough rooms but we originally booked pool access room . Would 'not recommend as there was no privacy with curtains open . We upgraded to a suite on level 2 and were very happy with the space. Pool is way to small and not enough lounges . We went to Finns beach club each day . Short Aus $6 ride away .
Breakfast was fine and room service range good . 
Ideally located for walking around . There are many options for dinner within 5 mins walk
title: Great position

text: Spent a month at The Kirana Bali Hotel and had a great time. Friendly and bi-lingual staff, very nice restaurant, clean and well run property + close to most everything around the Canggu area - can walk to a lot of places but cabs are also available.
title: Nice place to stay

text: Great hotel, excellent location, everything is well priced. The spa is lovely and again well priced (tax is negotiable). The breakfast was good. As with most of Bali, wifi was hopeless. Shuttle buses into Seminyak were also a plus.
title: Great hotel

text:
Before checking into the Kirana, we stayed at a much more expensive resort in Canggu. The Kirana has everything you need in a hotel for a pleasant stay in Canggu. The pool area is a little small though and made it difficult to find seating around it most days. The rooms are rather new looking and modern. Air con worked well. 

It's nothing fancy but you won't be spending much time lounging at the hotel anyway in Canggu!
title: Perfectly good spot

text:
Hotel was clean and comfortable. Never had issue with security of belongings (room safe also provided) and staff were all really friendly with good English.
Bed was comfortable with a selection of pillows - AC was nice and cool. Spacious room with a balcony and great view of the ocean.
Roof top also has some bean bags and panoramic views to lax out with in the sun.

Restaurant:
On the ground level next to the pool. Breakfast was complimentary with the room and very generous. Lunch/dinner meals were also pretty tasty as long as you keep to local themed meals (rice/curry). Only had one desert and it was very average. Creme Brûlée that was more like a runny custard - no crispy layer at all, but to be fair they apologised and offered a replacement. 
Just didn't understand the dish. 
Coffee was fantastic. Every time. Loved the coffee in Bali.

They also have a spa/professional therapeutic massage on the 3rd floor. Brilliant
$10 for 60 mins is just great value. Sore muscles from surfing in the morning were gone by afternoon.

Location is really convenient as well. Takes 5 minutes to walk to the beach (maybe less but there's no rush)
There are multiple cafes, shops, bars and specialty stores all within a five minute stroll distance.
Road is busy with tourists on scooters but it's like 3m wide so no issues walking.

ATM down near the beach for getting local currency. 

Old Mans restaurant/sports bar on the beach has free WiFi and good food, cheap beer and always loaded with tourists.

Cost $35 dollars for a taxi from the airport.

Check out is early 10am, so if you're on a late night flight I recommend checking into the Novotel Airport hotel for the 10 hours or so from when you check out. Costs around $50 but much more comfortable than sleeping on the floor at the airport and chances are you'll spend that amount at the airport anyway on food and what not while you're waiting
title: Kirana Hotel - 6 Day Stay

text: Stayed three nights in the penthouse with private plunge pool. Ocean view. Breakfast nice & adequate. Helpful staff. Some great restaurants in walking distance. Great spa across the road. Balcony needs some maintenance.
title: The Penthouse

text: The staff at the Kirana was very welcoming and we really felt at home during our stay. The rooms are clean and well equipped even if there were some signs of usage in the bathroom. The breakfast was very good, especially the banana pancakes. The pool area is very beautiful and clean. We also visited the spa at Kirana, which was a very nice experience too.
title: Nice hotel, very good location in Canggu

text:
Absolutely horrible service with the hotel reception.  We requested a taxi and provided the complete address from Google maps for our destination and the receptionist read the complete address through a walkie talkie and the person on the other end replied with the price of 180,000 idr. Once driving the driver changed the price to 400,000 idr!!!!! 

And when we called the hotel while on the road to let them know they stood by the driver and would not honor the price they have.   They said we never told them it was South kuta, just kuta. But we showed them the hotel address on Google maps and they read the entire address, only leaving the zip code out. We never read the address out loud,  when they said where do you want to go we showed it on the phone.  

The fact that the hotel wouldn't even bother to call the driver to sort it out is terrible customer service and to say the driver can charge 400,000 if he wants to even though they knew the charge is 180,000 is unacceptable.  

When i said i will make sure i write this on tripadvisor as a fair warning to other guests the reply was "go ahead". So, don't take their taxis unless you are ready to pay over double the fees. 

 fyi, the taxi from that same destination to this hotel cost 138,000 earlier in the day.   180,000 seemed fair enough.  400,000? Absurd. I hope this is not a common practice at this hotel and hope management is aware of this and addresses it immediately.
title: Careful their taxis change the rates once on the road and the hotel backs them

text:
This is a great place to stay, close to the beach, although walking is a bit far. Get a moped.
Rooms are nice, although there is some maintenance to be done especially in the bathrooms.
Nice pool and friendly staff.
Missing a bit of charm in the pool/restaurant area. The hotel was full but no guests around.
Recommend this place
title: Nice hotel

text: This place was so good to us. We stayed 3 nights at first and then another 3 nights after a night in ubud, because we liked this place so much. The rooms are perfect. Really spacious, a smart tv and nice and big bathrooms. The hotel offers free bike usage, which is perfect for going to the beach to surf. Breakfast is really good with a lot of choice (recommend eggs Benedict) We would definitely come bakc here again. Its the best of canggu, we stayed in 2 other places.
title: Perfect Bali

text: We had the pleasure of spending 6 nights at this lovely hotel in a Kirana suite.  It was perfect for 2 adults and 1 child.  It had a spacious bedroom with a king bed and our son slept in the separate living area on a rollaway bed.  Both rooms had a tv so it was perfect to be able to relax in separate rooms but be together.  The breakfast was great value - there were 2 choices of american and continental breakfast - and room service is 24 hours.  We really loved the location - Canggu is very spread out but we loved this street as it was a short walk to the beach and lots of great cafes and restaurants.  My only grip would be that the pool area is too small.
title: Great location and value for money!

text:
Second stay at the Kirana, stayed last year in pool suite room and this year in a pool access room. The difference a year makes is amazing, the wooden pool deck and restaurant floor has lots of loose boards with nail heads poking up so be careful with those bare feet people. There is a lot of building going on around the area, but unless you're overly sensitive the noise is only slightly audible. Lots of new shops and restaurants such as Old Mans, Deus Ex Machinas, Monggos etc all a short walk away, even a barber shop (Dirty Sanchez), across the road, as well as lots of smaller restos and warungs. 
The food in the hotel restaurant is still ok, although apart from breakfast we only ate there once
The room was clean, the aircon great especially after a day in the sun and the fridge kept the drinks icy cold👍
The staff are very friendly  and do their best to help you although some found language barrier a problem with the cleaning staff we didn't. Be patient people, they have to cope with probably 10 different languages a day.
The pool was always clean and cool, and with the aircon was also a great relief from the heat of the day.
All in all we still love coming here but like most of Bali it's becoming overly crowded, almost a mini Legian but without the street hawking. 
I would have given the hotel 4/5 stars but for all the loose boards and nail heads. I think the price is ok, but you can get some great deals if you look around. We will stay here again.
title: It's getting busy

text:
There is so much wrong with this hotel it is hard to know where to start . . .

We made the mistake of staying at this terrible hotel. We arrived all relaxed and in a good mood after a visit to Ubud. This quickly changed . . .

We requested a room for three (two adults and a teenager). We were advised the deluxe room could accommodate three. We paid. When we got up to the room there was only a double bed, so sleeping room for two only. 

We went back down to reception and queried the lack of a third bed, only to be told we could pay extra for an extra bed.

We told the guy on reception that he had just sold us a room for three that only slept two. 

After an hour of waiting we ended up in a standard room with an extra bed - but we still paid the price for the deluxe room. They were unwilling to reduce the price despite the fact that we ended up with a much smaller room than what we had paid for.

So a word of warning . . . they'll try to sell you the most expensive room irrespective of how many you're looking to accommodate. Then they'll charge you for extra beds . . .

But that's not all. When we were there they were draining the pseudo rice fields in the hotel garden. We know Bali can smell, but it was disgusting. There were also loads of mosquitos due to the standing water.

The stink of the water being drained out of the rice fields was only the start, though.

In our room the smell was even worse - the putrid smell of mould. 

The bed (mattress and sheets) were also damp. It was really borderline to sleep in the damp and smelly bed.  

They probably do clean now and then, but our room was dirty as  . . . stains on the bed sheets, mould in the shower. You might expect this in cheaper hotels, but not at this price.

For a fairly new hotel, things were falling apart all over the place. Some of the faults were dangerous. You wouldn't want to be here with a small kid.

Do yourself a big favour and steer well clear of the crappy Kirana.There are much better places in Canggu. 

If you book the Kirana be aware it could ruin you holiday. It's a stinky, dirty, expensive hole that's made to look like a designer hotel.
title: Absoutely terrible hotel (it should come with a health warning)

photos.caption: Mosquito breeding ground direct in the breakfast room

text: A very lovely place, the rooms are even bigger nicer and more luxurious than we expected, a beautiful place and great value for money. Would love to go back. The breakfast was nice, the service and friendliness of the staff added great value.
title: Wonderful place

text: Its a nice place. the regular rooms are nice. The Penthouse is where its at. it has its own mini pool. a great place for friends to get together and hang out. The restaurant is nice (over priced) but nice. Great places around the corner from the hotel
title: Stayed in multiple rooms here

text: We had a great time at Kirana, it's central and within close walking distance to everything. The hotel staff are welcoming and very helpful. Breakfast is great, lots to choose from a menu. Our air conditioner leaked and they were quick to sort out the problem. We would stay there again.
title: Great place to stay

text: We stayed at the kirana with our 6 month year old girl and absolutely loved it!, staff were amazing! Food was amazing ! location was spot on, close to all the great restaurants and a 5 minute walk to the beach. Room was great but probably would have upgraded room size with the little one. Will defiantly stay here again!
title: Loved it!

text:
This is the absolute worst hotel we have ever stayed in. The air conditioning leaked all over our stuff, the ceiling of the bathroom leaked water, the sheets smelled of body odour, the bathroom flooded with water every time you took a shower, the housekeeping would knock on our door at 10pm (and continue to do so after we asked them not to) and the staff were so unhelpful. 

To top it off, when we left, the staff accused us of stealing a glass from the room, and would not let us leave. Finally after we had to say many times we did not take the glass, they reluctantly let us leave.

The only good thing was the location, but we would never stay here again. The price per night is relatively high compared to other Canggu hotels but next time we will book somewhere cheaper where at the least the staff are nicer and basic cleanliness standards are met. 

Do not stay here.
title: Worst Hotel we have ever stayed in

text: We visited Bali in november 2015 and managed to stay in 4 hotels - a few days in each. Kirana was definitely my #1! All new , stylish, comfortable, beautiful and simple at the same time. Breakfasts good and generous. Staff - friendly. In a walking distance to a great surfing spot and not far from the shopping centre, where a free shuttle can take you. For me it's a perfect place for a surfer , who enjoys comfort.
title: A wonderful place to rest and surf in comfort.

text: Amazing breakfast and the comfiest bed! The staff are helpful and the room was clean Its in a good location to all the great restaurants The pool is bit small and the view not to good from your room It said sea view but it wasn't really ... Its a fairly new hotel. You do need to bring your own hair dryer. There is a shuttle to Seminyak Square  and Serenity Yoga is about a 10 min walk  Its very close to the beach which is a surfie haven
title: Value for money

text:
I stayed at this hotel in May 2016.

Pros:
- The staff were fantastic
- The pool was cold and clean
- The girls in the spa were really nice
- About a seven minute walk to the beach
- Felt safe
- Free breakfast, which was quite good

Cons:
- The shower sprayed and pooled EVERYWHERE, the entire bathroom was soaked
- The sheets weren't changed in five days, which ended up smelling pretty gross with the sweat and humidity
** The first two cons were HUGE for me... I don't think I would go back or recommend the hotel. 
- Quite a few ants running around the room
title: Great pool, but wouldn't recommend for the rooms

text: Centrally located although still a 10 minute walk to the beach. Our room was perfectly acceptable for the price, comfy bed and spacious. Lovely helpful staff and the chef cooked the best Beef Rendang I've ever tasted. The alacarte breakfast had variety and always presented nicely. Great having the push bikes to use (albeit requiring some maintenance). Great sunsets over the pool.
title: All you need is provided

text:
The rooms are not garden view and definitely not ocean view. When I wanted to see the ocean view room, all the staff did was took us one step higher on the SAME side of the hotel and asked us to look left and TRY TO SEE THE OCEAN. 

The bathrooms smelled. When we asked for the toothbrush, they said they usually don't give those for "the kirana room", and the iron was only available upon request. 

The breakfast was very disappointing. It was NOT a buffet. It was alacarte based on your order. It felt like the staff were more narrow-minded than helpful. 

OVERALL BAD EXPERIENCE. Never going there again.
title: Disappointed, Awful, NOT 4 STAR!!

text:
Stayed at The Kirana for the night to get a feel of Canggue area. Location-wise, the hotel is 5-10 min walk to the beach and same distance to the middle of Canggu. Very convenient. 

Service-wise also typical of Indonesia, polite and gracious. The only downside to me is that the shower area could use better maintenance with mould already growing in the see through mirror area. 

Note: There's currently maintenance going on in front of hotel so it's not hard to overshoot the hotel at night. 

Note: Local taxi cartel in this area (like many other areas in Bali) means you can't use apps like Go Jek or Uber. However, The Kirana can make ride arrangement at the fixed cost similar to that of a metered Bali Taxi (local Bluebird brand).
title: Nice location and hotel but could better maintainance

text:
It was our first experience staying at Canggu, away from the overcrowded Seminyak. Batu Bolong is a friendly neighbourhood surrounded by friendly laid-back people with peculiar taste. The Kirana is one of the place where you can bring your family or group of friends to stay and make it your home in the middle of the eclectic Canggu. We were welcomed by friendly front officers and tasty drinks at start. Our room was decent, really well-cleaned, complete with big tv and peaceful scenery towards the paddy fields. A little defect was the wash basin wasn't work really well and shower sink was kind of smelly. 
Choice of breakfast were really in vary and delicious. On my next visit to Bali, I will definitely stay here again.
title: Homey Hotel

text:
Nice room with enough space. Nice bed. Big tv. though,the finishing touch is not so good. The shower looks used. Overfload easily. 

 The security crew is friendly and helpfull. The manager is a bit leds. 
Small swimming pool
title: All good

text:
Super rooms, wonderful pool water like silk, Lovely staff and service. Bikes a bit battered, Hope to stay there again. The most comfortable beds just like home!
Indonesian breakfast porridge and banana fritters great.
title: Lovely Boutique Hotel in Canggu

text:
Stayed 2 nights in The Kirana June 17-19 in room 302, deluxe ocean view room, top floor (3 storey building). 

The hotel driver picked me up after an evening arrival at DPS airport, including waiting for me whilst I stood at the baggage carousel for 1.5hrs. I was charge 340k IDR for the trip, slightly more than a taxi from the airport, but with the convenience of not having to queue for a taxi ticket, or bargaining for a price when the ticket desk is closed at night.

The rooms are bigger than their standard rooms, probably bigger than international room standards, but average size for Bali.

Aircon (individual split system) was very cold (essential in Bali) but dripped on the floor, I put a towel underneath to stop the "splat" noise.

2 x 330ml bottles of water are supplied each day and you can buy bottles from the mini bar, or if you have legs, go to the little shop across the road for half the price.

The hotel is 30 second walk from The Practice, an awesome new yoga studio in Canggu, run by Octavio.  There is a apotek (chemist) nearby and some very good cafes and restaurants. (try Betelnut)

Breakfast at the hotel was pretty ordinary, my omelet on the first day was undercooked and on the second day the chicken sausage was cold.  The tomato and potato were good.

The pool rooms are EXTREMELY close to the pool, great if that's what you want, but be aware you will have restricted privacy.

The bar. pool and restaurant are all on the ground floor, and there are 3 storeys of rooms above that.

My room (top floor) had no traditional Bali sewerage smell, perhaps lower down it does.  Wifi was excellent, I think have a router on each floor, password is the same, just choose the one with best signal.

Bathroom was nice when it was dry but water leaked out the shower door and ran over the floor towards the toilet which was kind of unpleasant.

Totally recommend for location to The Practice and also to Canggu beach, just a short walk away.  I would call it a 4 star boutique hotel.

Would return again for the right price, but at $80-90 a night I might check the competition.
title: Modern hotel close to Canggu beach and The Practice

text:
Lovely little hotel with awesome staff. 
Booked a pool access room which was lovely. Room was clean and nice with strong wifi signal , strong air con and loads of cable channels to surf.

 Toilet was huge with a nice bath tub as well as a standing shower. However do let the shower run for a few mins before going in as it does take sometime to heat up as well as to get rid of the sewage stench that does disappear shortly after.

There are not enough deck chairs to go around cos the pool is small. So don't be surprise to see people lying on sunbeds right outside your room. You don't get your own beds just because you book pool access. Pool is also more suited for soaking then swimming laps . The pool water also tends to overflow onto the sundecks especially when someone  attempt to swim in there , so don't leave your shoes outside your door unless you want them wet. 

It can also be noisy as people talk and splash about the pool in the morning . The pool is literally 5 steps away from your door . So if you are a light sleeper , it's better that you take rooms that are higher up the floors .

Breakfast is a treat with so many choices to choose from the menu. Service staffers are simply awesome .

Kirana's location is also convenient . 
Down the road they are like 10-15mins walk  away from OLd Mans, Canggu beach and Echo beach. Along the way there you will find mini mart and local warong/eateries for cheap eats. 

Up the road from Kirana is a stretch of more upscale cafes ,boutiques , massage spas and restaurants . So try the food at Little Flinders which serves good food and decent drinks . It's not very cheap and neither is it very expensive . For loca warong do try the one right beside the hotel . Cheap and good. 

For massage ,head to Gold Dust Spa and try their stress buster massage while seated in a chair. It's really good . 

Overall will definitely come back to Kirana again in the future and will recommend to friends .
title: Lovely little hotel

text:
I should not tell about this very good hotel, to keep it a secret gem, but to thank the staff for the very nice stay here is my recommendation:

Professionally run hotel in strategically very good location to main attractions in Canggu (i.e. the nicest cafe's, bars and restaurants, nicest yoga studio and the beach - which is in walking distance, if you are willing to walk something like 600 meters). 

Lovely staff that will give you assistance regarding anything you will want to do or requests you may have for your stay, if there is a problem, the staff will do the best to solve it. 

The hotel is not too big - this way it will be even if fully booked not feel busy. The ground is spacious compared to other hotels around. The upstairs rooms have a nice view to the ocean. If you prefer doing indoor sports, which is no need for me: The gym might need a renovation. The spa is very good. 

I did visit Canggu several times and this is my favorite place to stay - I will return!
title: One of the best options in Canggu

text:
As this was our first visit to Bali and we arrived late, we selected a hotel which was not located on one of the crowded party beaches like Kuta. We found Canggu to be a good starting point and reserved accommodation for 2 nights at the Kirana. We were not disappointed although the ocean view rooms have not much view of the ocean and soon will not have any Ocean view anymore due to the construction of a building nearby.
The hotel has a nice pool and a well equipped fitness room. Staff was very friendly and helpful and the grounds are well maintained with its own mini rice paddies. The hotel is close to the beach although the beach looks like more a spot for surfers and is less or not adequate for swimmers. We enjoyed the restaurant which serves nice dishes of good quality.
title: Nice and quiet

text: Very lovely hotel. Staff is very friendly and Spa very compentent in providing massages. Not too big and crowded. Rooms are nice. Had the same experience regarding sulfate smell in bathroom, once you turn on the shower. In addition constant noise from the toilet. Cleanliness ok, but you could certainly enhance the bathroom. Bed comfortable. Breakfast great size and variety. Fresh juices however only on additional charge, which I certainly think shall be improved as a 4star hotel. You get great juices everywhere in this city at super low prices. Same for dinner. High prices, small portions / tasty but very expensive. My biggest complaint goes with regards to complaint management, which is very unprofessional. I provided 2 quality reviews with comments during and at the end of my stage, I further provided comments to staff and in writing on the bills without any return. Lastly, at the checkout nobody could assist me and they didn't return to me as promised. This was very disappointing. Lastly very inflexible in changing 1 day, claiming it was due to booking site restriction, but it wasn't. After discussing it was clear that they were unwilling to change, so I was charged an extra night at full price (far above their target price) although the hotel was empty! This was part of the complaint not treated. Also all suggestions provided seemed in vain. That's sad. But again, this goes to the management, not to the staff that is very friendly and helpful.
title: Beautiful hotel room for improvement regarding service

text: Perfect location. Spent the days between the pool at the Kirana, Batu balong beach and nearby cafe & restaurants. We stayed in the pool access rooms, great to open up your door and go for a swim. Staff were lovely and helpful. Breakfast was good too
title: We will be back

text: Loved staying in this hotel. Very affordable and a great location. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The only con was the food. I had such GREAT food at my other hotels throughout Bali, but the Kirana's room service and restaurant left much to be desired. The complimentary breakfast is decent, but the lunch and dinner options are pretty bland. Fortunately, there are ton of restaurants within walking distance. I encourage anyone who stays here to explore the shops and also take a car to Echo beach!
title: Great stay + location

text:
Stayed at the Kirana for family trip. We stayed at their 4 bedroom villa! We had a little hickup about the villa in the beginning but their fast response to make things right was amazing! The villa itself was fabulous and hugeeee! Perfect for those who got a big family! The foods were great! We had their breakfast pretty much everyday! We truly appreciate their great service in every single department ( front desk- housekeeping - f&b dept). Everyone was amazing and accomodating. Special shout out to Mrs. Komang ( the resident manager) and Mr. Dewa ( HK Manager), they went above and beyond to fix every issue encountered during our stay. 
About the location, it couldnt be more perfect located! Super close to both batu bolong beach and echo beah ( great deal for those who surf), and also there are tons of cool restaurant within walking distance!
title: Perfect location

text: It was our first time to Bali for a friends wedding - we stayed in ubud for 3 days before heading to the Kirana and had the most wonderful 4 nights there. We stayed in the suite on the 2nd floor which was very spacious with a balcony, the breakfast was outstanding and the spa very serene. The staff were all friendly and helpful.
title: Wonderful stay

text:
I stayed at the Kirana with my partner for 5 nights and would have extended for a few more nights if it wasn't booked out. The staff is so friendly and makes you feel very welcome. During our stay we could attend Balinese dancing nights, blessing ceremony and rooftop movie night, but we were busy checking out the many great restaurant options in the area. Kirana is walking distance to the beach, but you will still need a scooter to get around the Canggu area. The beds and rooms were super comfy BUT the shower was in a very poor condition. It would smell like sewage for the first few seconds and the shower looked like it needs a serious scrub. The shower curtain is also stained with mould:-/
The Internet is also soooo slow that it's almost useless. The Internet is really fast everywhere else so I don't understand why it wouldn't be at the Kirana.
title: Great but room for improvement

text:
Rooms are nice and very clean, beds are very comfortable, staff is friendly. Food is mostly good (especially the Balinese dishes). Internet speed is extremely slow (1-2 Mbps) and unreliable; if you need to work, get a plan B. The pool is very nice. It gets the sun almost all day. The spa is beautiful; treatments are far from European standards but are the priced accordingly. 
All around a good stay at an honest price if you don't expect too much.
Highest point: the location! It's excellent, very close to the beach!
title: Good place to stay. Good value

text:
Great hotel ,,, all you need for a stay in Bali ,,,,,
Walking distance to beach,,   Great restaurants and bars nearby,,,
The Kirana hotel had great staff,  great breakfast ,,  and accomodation was good as well,,,  
We found it relaxing, and would recommend!!!
title: Perfect location..

text: We had a great stay at Kirana. Convenient and quiet location close to several beaches. Easy with cheap scooter rentals available at the reception. Contacted us on their own initiative after the booking was done through Expedia, and we then easily arranged for airport pick up. Big room with sufficient space for a comfortable extra bed, not the cheap style extra beds several hotels operates with.
title: Great stay

text: Stayed in 4BR Villa with families. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The villa is exquisite and well-designed. The staff service is impeccable. Would highly recommend this Villa. The other rooms are also great for Honeymooners.
title: One of the best

text:
Great value, 5 min walk from the beach and Old Man's. Friendly staff, newish hotel, clean rooms, wifi works, air con works, hot water and good water pressure, rooms cleaned daily and a multitude of cafes, restaurants and bars within 2 min scooter ride or 5-10 min walk.

The included breakfasts are ok... however, we found that at least half the time we walked up the road to places like Little flinders, Crate & Canteen where for $10-15 gives you great options of food, fresh juices and good coffee.

The ground floor pool rooms are right on the edge of the pool and give little privacy - we stayed in a 2nd floor sea view room - you can see the sea if you walk out on the balcony :-)
title: Friendly, great location for the price!

text:
We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived at Kirana. Our first impression was of the reception staff, who were very pleasant and full of information. Sri was terrific with the kids.
We checked in to room 105 (a suite) which had more than enough space for me and my 2 young boys. The only negative was that the shower hasn't been maintained over time, so mould has formed in the grout. I've found that this is often the case in Bali hotels. Definitely not a deal breaker.
To top off a great experience, the boys got to feed the koi fish every morning while we waited for breakfast and they loved the complimentary golf cart ride to the beach each day.
Kirana was great value for money and I highly recommend.
title: Pleasantly surprised!

text: Your do not pay 5 star prices, so do not expect it, but if the you are looking for a budget hotel with everything you need- this is it. Big comfortable beds, good linen, cleaned well every day, well stocked mini-bar, 24 hour room service , good pool. The staff are outstanding. Your wish is their command- and fast! Special mention for SRI at reception. What a legend!
title: VALUE for money- excellent location

text: This is lovely but small hotel, we stayed in a pool access room. The rooms are plain but perfect for what you need, I think we may not have not enjoyed it as much if the room had not been pool accessible as it just gave it that nicer feel. The hotel is clean, staff are so helpful, friendly and give a five star service. We had breakfast, lunch and dinner here and the food was absolutely delicious! That's why we just kept eating there so hats off to the chief. The street the hotel is on is going through construction (although there was no noise pollution at all) but there was not much on the street for shopping etc. Its a very short walk to the beach and the beach has a great set up with a few bars. I would recommend this hotel especially beach lovers! As it seemed to be a surfers paradise. The reception is beautiful also set up outside just in front of the hotel.
title: Lovely little hotel

text: Just returned from spending 14 days at Kirana Hotel. It is a nice family Hotel with great location, close to the beach and many restaurants. Walking distance to Echo beach also. The Hotel staff is very friendly, loved all the ladies working there, always with a big smile on their face. The room had a comfortable huge bed, safe box, mini bar, clean towels every day and some of days also new toiletries. All rooms have their own balcony with pool view, on the higher level sea view also. On the top floor there is a spa. Breakfast options could have been better, for example they serve only Balinese coffee, if you ask for americano there is an extra charge. You can generally find really good places serving quality and variety of breakfast in the area. Pool area is cozy. We didn't try the restaurant. A little bit confusion at the payment process both during the booking process and as well as paying at reception for any other bill (minibar/transfers). They also didn't accept euros. The room had some maintenance issues as bathroom door was not closing or bathroom sink was blocking. We used their transfer services to/from airport they were on time.
title: Thank you very much!

text: Stayed for three days as a couple, enjoyed free breakfast, wi -fi and the close proximity to the great surfing cangu beach . Many good restaurants inthe area. Good hotel but a bit overpriced . Not many massage places around.
title: Good hotel

text: Canggu was my favourite place to visit in Bali and The Kirana and all its staff were helpful and friendly. Shower drain was a wee bit blocked and you could stand a spoon up in the morning coffee. That being said, breakfast was great and the room was beautiful and cozy.
title: Cute hotel close to the waves

text:
Only 50 metres to the best yoga studio in Bali and a 10min walk to the beach. The staff are very friendly and helpful. My room for the 1st 4 nights - the toilet squeaked and the air conditioner leaked - not so good for a hotel only 3 years old.
The next room - poolside - can be a bit noisy :( So if you are wanting a quieter room - opt for one on floor 2 or 3.
The breakfast which was included as part of our stay - not so healthy :( Would have been nice to have fresh juice, instead of the bottled variety.
Overall the hotel is great value for money
title: Very convient location to The Practice!!!

text: This is a great hotel close to the beach at Old Mans. The staff were very friendly and the pool side rooms very comfortable and very good value. The location is excellent and close to fabulous places to eat. The bikes are a real bonus to cycle to all of the local attractions.
title: Fantastic Experienece

owner_response.text:
Dear Andrew H

Thank you so much for taing sometime to share your experience with us.
Glad to know that the staffs assist you well during your stay and also our free push bike is advantage for you.

Trust you enjoy the holiday and spend great time also at The Oldman.

Look forward to welcoming you in the near future again.

Sincerely,
Komang - rm@thekiranabali.com
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: We were staying down the road and noticed the sign for the Wednesday's traditional Balinese dance. So we enjoyed a three course meal and a few cocktails. Service was a little slow particularly given there were only four of us at any time dining and drinking. Food was quite good but not cheap. Musicians and dancers were fantastic. Looked like a lovely small hotel.
title: Enjoyable night out

owner_response.text:
Dear Mrskussy,

Thank you for sharing the wednesday traditional Balinese dance night.
Noted that you enjoy the performance, but at the same time you expect to have the service faster. Let us have this checked, to make sure this is not happening again in the future.

Thank you,
rm@thekiranabali.com
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
I've written plenty of reviews so you can feel safe in the knowledge that I'm not a perpetual whiner. 
I say it as it is
And it is absolutely disgraceful. 
The great reviews of fellow reviewers led me to this horrible place and it begs the question; what the hell are you thinking????!!!!!!!
Firstly I will be honest . The price point suggests an average hotel.
But at any price it would be a rip off.
So before I tell you my story I will say that I expect to receive a letter back from management suggesting they did the best they could (ultimately agreeing with me of the disastrous circumstances and giving me back my money) 
They have indeed refunded my money . 
No apology or back peddling required. 
It's still a disgrace and you should know about it!!
1st room smelt like a sewerage collection centre
2nd room smelt like the subsidiary of a waste collection centre
3rd room smelt fine looked ok
The DVD player did not work
3 attempts later and an hour wasted the DVD was up and running ... But no sound...
Ok we gave up on watching a movie. Time for bed
I turn down the sheets and was immediately thrown by the smell of someone else's body odour emanating from the sheets
Oh dear Lord!!!!
Upon further investigation the sheets were totally and disgustingly soiled from the previous inhabitants !!!!
We packed our bags
Called the manager
He himself was disgusted and offered us our money back
The end
title: No no no no no no never

text: We were staying in a villa in Canggu which unfortunately for us was double booked on our last night. I found The Kirana through a group website, and since it was just down the road, booked it. The price was very reasonable, and check in was a breeze. We received some extremely bad information just as we were checking in and the girls at reception were so caring, thoughtful and empathetic. We were given an upgrade to a suite which overlooked the pool. We were given a refreshing cold drink as we arrived, and our bags brought to our room. We only needed the room for the afternoon as we were leaving for the airport at 10pm so we didn't use the bed. Other than the embarrassing Aussie yobbos in the pool, the room was delightful. The airconditioning worked very well (it was an extremely hot day) and didn't labour at all. The bathroom did have a sewer smell as can happen in Bali and we understand this. The room was well appointed, but my biggest comment would have to be the staff. Once again, friendly, compassionate, pleasant, helpful the list goes on. Please thank them again on our behalf. I would definitely stay here again, and mostly for the pleasantness of the employees. An absolute delight.
title: Last minute option - glad we did!

owner_response.text:
Dear Kezzh2,

Thank you for your kindly sharing.
We are happy to let you know that the staffs really happy to read this review. They aslo thank you for trusting them and let them assist your needs.
Glad that you also enjoy the free upgrade to the suite room pool access.
Hope to welcoming you back again and stay longer with us.

Please stay in touch

Sincerely,
Komang - rm@thekiranabali.com
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Great view of my room with a peaceful green rice terrace, many choices of breakfast. Near by Canggu beach. 5mins walk.
The room is not very clean, for example the curtain of the bathroom. The sheets is bit smelly, smells humidity.
Spa worth to try.
title: Leisure Stay

owner_response.text:
Dear ste y,

Thank you for your kindly feed back, noted on your message for we to bring this matters to our room department, in related to the sheet, we will make sure that this should not happen, as we are working with third party for all our linen laundry.
Glad that you have sometime to enjoy the spa.

Trust you had a great time in Canggu, and please stay in touch!

Sincerely,
Komang - rm@thekiranabali.com
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: The Kirana is located 5 mins away from the beach and restaurants. The staff members are really sweet but the room was not great. It smelt funny, the balcony door lock was broken so I had some little creepy crawlie's visits (I hate insects and bugs). Mosquitos were a problem so they had to spray the room while I was gone. No hair dryer or toothbrush. The hotel was full so I could not change my room which left me with not many choices.
title: Great location but not rooms

text: Only had 3 nights, not long enough! Staff were excellent, hotel was very clean and comfortable and our room had a nice ocean view. Would definitely stay there again. There are many good restaurants/Cafes within walking distance.
title: Pleasant stay

owner_response.text:
Dear jim_outred,

Thanks for sharing the enjoyable experience!
Please stay in touch :)

Thank you,
Komang - rm@thekiranabali.com
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: We loved our stay here. Great location to the beach and foodie places such as deus ex machina and betelnut. The pool was cool on hot days and the spa on the third floor was lovely. Breakfast was awesome with all the options. Our only issue was the toilet kept breaking and they had to fix it a few times but I told them the issue and it shouldn't be a problem now. Also early mornings we would wake up with the sounds of claws above us. Could be possible rats, but maybe not. Other than that it's a great place.
title: Awesome hotel

owner_response.text:
Dear ttdean88,

Thank you for your kindly review, and noted that you had a great time at The Kirana Bali in CANGGU! Indeed the area are happening with many choices of places to hang out.
Some input for our improvement is jotted down. Thanks!!! :)

Thank you and shall look forward to welcoming you back to The Kirana.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: I have stay in Kirana for our anniversary with my daughter as well. Room is very good with a modern desain, water temperature very nice, nice food and drink, we almost spend our time only in the hotel. It just feel so great. Our daughter love the pool so much even though she is not swim well. We love the staff. They are very friendly and helpfull. At night time they gave us a surprise for our anniversary. We love it so much. Again Thank you so much for the hospitality, we will definetly come back and stay again.
title: Abosulately Come Back

owner_response.text:
Dear Prama01,

Thank you so much for spending the precious time with us at The Kirana. Great to learn that yor daugther Nindya loves the vibes of the hotel.
Hope to welcoming you and family back to The Kirana.

Happy Anniversary to you!

Cheers,,,
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: We took the suite with the pool view and we loved it! Great hotel staff and beautiful hotel :) I am very happy with this hotel choice and would love to come back! Food was tasty and pool was nice. Canggu beach is only 5 minutes walk away, that is totally surfers paradise there with a beach bar with live music or DJ-s.
title: Super nice hotel!

owner_response.text:
Dear Krista V,

it was lovely to have you with us at The Kirana!
Glad to know that the staff, food and pool are accommodating your needs you during your stay.

Hope you will catch another waves at Batu Bolong beach soon again!

Thanks!!!

Cheers,
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: Me and my girlfriend stayed for four days at Kirana a few weeks ago and we a good time. This place is was good because its close to the beach with bars and restraunts close by, the staff were all friendly and the pool was nice. One thing they could improve on is making the room service more affordable. It was basically the same price as eating at a hotel in Australia. Overall 4/5
title: Affordable hotel with great location

owner_response.text:
Dear Lloyd T,

Thank you for your kindly update. good to know that the staff manage to interact with you to cater your needs.
As for the room service related has been measured by giving the great food and service.
However, for your future reference, Canggu provides many option for restaurant/bar, so every of our guest will having no difficulties to find the desired food and match guest need.

Hope to welcoming you back to The Kirana Bali, Canggu.

Thanks!!!!
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: We really enjoyed staying at this lovely hotel.  The location is excellent.  Walking distance to Batu Bolong Beach and my favourite gym around the corner (Bali Fit).  There are also great restaurants on the same street and the breakfast provided at the hotel was excellent as well.  Would def. stay here again.
title: Great Location!

owner_response.text:
Dear jljkl22

Thank you for the reviews!

Trust that you did well explore the area and make a great journey of it.
So hope to welcoming you back soon again at The Kirana Bali!

Thanks!!!
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Beautiful hotel in a great location. If you want to surf and rest luxuriously, then look no further. Rooms have strong A/C and the breakfast included is great! There is a pool to access and a rooftop with sunset views.

You can walk or scooter to nearby restaurants and down to Batu Bolong beach.
title: Luxury in surf town!

owner_response.text:
Hi Warren T,

Its a great sharing, thanks!!!

Yess,,, surfers need to enjoy luxurious, and definitely this sharing worth a million thanks!
Noted that you've explore Canggu with the scooter, a perfect choices!

Looking forward to welcoming you back at The Kirana Bali, Canggu!

Thanks!
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: The staff was polite and helpful, one 'wow I apprecited that' moment was we were offered a ride to Seminyak by the driver because we were waiting for the shuttle that took longer than expected.  Room was clean and airy, and large with plenty of room in the living and bedroom spaces - I stayed in the penthouse room, so we had our own pool overlooking the beach (it was amazing for sunset watching and morning dips in the water).  Location was good, very short walk to the beach, and very short walk to the nearby restaurants up the street.  We tried to stay here again two weeks after but all rooms were booked. Would come back in a heartbeat!
title: COULDN'T HAVE ASKED FOR BETTER

text: Lovely place. The breakfast is amazing were you are able to choose from Continental, american or Indonesien. Its more than enough so dont worry. Also, the staff is really friendly and always got a smile on their faces. Internet are ok to be in Bali, not the best but works. Location is great with a 5 min Walk to batu balong beach.
title: Lovely place

text:
Firstly, the service provided by the staff were excellent - they were very nice and friendly and were more than to happy to suggest places for us to try. 
The rooms were spacious and clean - we stayed at the ground floor and has easy access to the pool. 
The food was decent and the location was pretty strategic to me - few mins walk to the beach and so many eateries within walking distance. Definitely recommend this place..
title: Simple and relaxing!

text: The rooms were ok and clean, but the staff were somewhat poor in terms of service. Breakfast service seemed to take forever to complete. The gym is pretty poor too. The place is a good distance away from the beach and other amenities too. Overall, it wasn't a good experience for us.
title: Good Hotel, Poor service, Not a great location too.

text:
Despite the new look and feel this hotel is tired and lacking excitement. 

The hotel itself is in one of the better locations, being so close to the beach. However the rooms let it down and the general design is typical of a hotel that dates quickly. 

The service from staff members was relatively good, however the rooms were old, small and had a awful smell to them. 

We found mould in the bathroom and the general cleanliness was lacking. 

The pool was great however not at all private for those rooms on the lower level adjacent to it. 

I wouldn't say this was a bad experience it just wasn't a memorable one.
title: Average Hotel Excellent Location.

text: Those was a nice hotel, good standard on the rooms and all the public areas. The breakfast could be better, the eggs was tasteless. Overall great value for what u pay. Close to canggu beach and the tree biggest bars in the area. The clean the rooms every day. The airport transfers the hotel fix I slightly to expensive.
title: Good hotel

text:
I satyed at this hotel for 4 nights. I had a room by the pool. The staff was very friendly and nice.
Roomservice was good.
The room was cleaned everyday. The hotel have shuttlebus to seminyak included.
The beach is 5 minutes away if you walk.

Canggu is a very nice location, relaxed and good restaurants.

I would recomend a trip to Tahana lot temple.
title: The best hotel i have stayed at i Bali

text: A great location, central to many attractions that shape Cangu! The service was impressive and the staff were so friendly. A stress free stay and the Balinese breakfast was amazing! Will definitely be coming back here with our family to relax again
title: Beautiful and easy

text:
We stayed there last week and very satisfied with the hotel.
Rooms were clean and have nice view to the ocean from balcony.
Breakfast was ala carte but food was nice.
Friendly staffs
Of course you can't compare it with 5 star hotel but it's great value for money
title: Great value

text:
I'm a little late in writing this review as we stayed back in October. We have travelled to Bali many but have not stayed in this area before and as such found it rather hard to decide where to stay as the area is very spread out.
In saying that I think we made a good choice although it did not start well. Our airport pickup did not eventuate and we caught a taxi instead which was really no hassle and ended up being cheaper anyway.
Checkin was problem free. We had a room on the top level looking towards the ocean. There is building work going on next door so don't know how long this lovely view will last. Room was excellent. Comfy bed, good a/c and wifi.
Breakfast was excellent. I had the best Eggs Benedict with good friendly service.
I can't really class these as negatives but the pool is very public as are all the rooms on the ground floor and the bar prices were a little pricey.
I used the Spa for a massage and it was excellent. One of the best massages I have had in Bali and not overly expensive.
Location was good. Walking distance to the beach and a good variety of restaurants. Remember, this area is not as developed and has no footpaths but also not as much traffic.
This area is not for everyone but if you venture out that way then you can't go wrong staying at the Kirana
title: Overall, pretty good

text: My husband did the searching and the booking through Agoda. There are 11 of us: 2 elderly, 2 singles, 4 parents, 2 toddlers and 1 infant. (They give me a baby crib!!) Must becareful with active toddlers, as the stair steps and swimming pool access are dangerous. I am amazed with the beautiful, big n clean villa. Downside is the open air shower in the upstair bedrooms. Other than that i think its okay. I havent try their food yet tho... peaceful, dont come here if you are looking for party scene
title: Booked the 4 bedroom villa

text:
Just returned from two weeks in Bali, the first week being spent here. It was one of the quietest hotels I have ever stayed in, the staff were wonderful as was the room. We paid a little extra to have a 'suite' room and it didn't disappoint, spacious bathroom, lounge and fab bedroom with a large screen tv. The balcony, a little cramped, overlooked the pool but the ocean view wasn't as expected.
We had an inclusive breakfast every morning which was ordered from the varied menu, no buffet style here, was all cooked to order and was delicious! We never used the restaurant for dinner as there are many local places to choose from.
The staff are so lovely here, everyone was so helpful and friendly, spoke good English and we shared a few nights just sat at the bar chatting with them.
Like many recently, we were worried about ash cloud, not knowing if we were actually going to fly, I emailed the hotel and they assured us the room would be held over until we did get there, that was reassuring as it was a non-refundable rate. Also I arranged a pick up from the airport (Au$34) and was greeted with a smile and an enthusiastic driver.
Only downside I found was the pool area, a bit cramped and the rooms that surround the pool seem to think the loungers are for them, we counted seven sunbeds for the whole hotel and didn't bother using it as the wonderful beach is 10 mins down the road.
Overall, I would recommend and we hope to stay here again.
title: Relaxing and friendly hotel

text:
Booked Kirana because of the price and pics (which are often deceiving) but was not disappointed. Got a great slow season rate of $45 but upgraded to a deluxe room w great views for $12 more, def worth it. It's a simple hotel but clean and comfortable and excellent for the price. The service is excellent, even by Bali standards. Great massage for $15. There is a higher rate for the pool access rooms that doesn't make sense to me as you lose privacy and don't have a view, but that's just my personal opinion. The pool is a bit small and there are limited lounge chairs but they are limited on space, might be crowded in peak season. 
Canggu is awesome once you settle in. Great place to explore by motorbike and lots of good cafes bars and restaurants. It's a surfers' Mecca so you get that kind of vibe here.  Good people watching. 
Would definitely recommend Kirana and Canggu  (pronounced Chan goo)
title: Definitely recommend

text: The hotel is well maintained with good facilities including a restaurant, pool and spa. Rooms were nice but wifi was often not working. The pool sometimes does get crowded as it is quite small, with 8 loungers for guests from 30 rooms. Location wise, the hotel, while offering an ocean view from certain rooms, is really about 10-mins from the beach. However, it is a comfortable walk and there are also many nice restaurants nearby, and you can watch an amazing sunset if you walk out to the beach. Rooms could be cleaner as we found hair and dust that was not ours. I seriously injured myself quite badly during the stay as the stairways are dark with no handrails and I fell, leaving me unable to walk. Staff were very helpful in arranging transport to the hospital and airport, though the costs of everything including the requested late check out were never made transparent until we were presented with the bill. If visiting, please ensure that you clarify how much you are paying for each service, and in which currency, as I was surprised to be asked to pay my arrival transfer in USD and the departure one in IDR and told to go a money changer in my crutches to get the right currency changed. Overall, place is great as a base, especially for the price, but the level of service is functional due to what seemed like poor training for staff.
title: Great hotel but service could be better.

text: I stayed at the Kirana for 3 nights, and enjoyed the hospitality, the spa, the closeness to the beach and the great food from their restaurant. Very nice and helpful staff. The hotel offers a driver to take you to see the sights of the island (payable), which was very nice. The only complaint was the restaurant he stoppet at for lunch - expensive and not very tasteful food. Ask for a different restaurant if you do any of the tours. Other that that - enjoy your stay at the Kirana.
title: Nice hotel close to beach

text: Our arrival in Bali was delayed by the volcanic ash cloud closing the airport but excellent communications from Ani and Ade on reception gave reassurance that our room was saved for us whenever we got there. Kadek met us at the airport and Wayen and team provided a delicious breakfast on arrival. There was a great view of the "Old Man's" wave from our balcony. The hotel is in a perfect position in Canngu for beaches and the best warungs, bars and restaurants. We can't wait to stay there again.
title: Excellent service in Bali

text: Stayed 6 nights here and i only have good things to say. Decent breakfast, very nice staff that helped out when needed, and even drove me to a ding repair shop (redz Surfshop) so I could get my surfboard fixed. Back massage was good, and not to expensive. The best part is that it is close enough to walk to old mans, (ca 5 min)and other peaks towards echo beach if your there to surf. Same distance to good places to eat.
title: Great place

text: OK first of all unless you are 18 or simply insane you have to stay in Canggu. Secondly, stay in this place. It's relatively cheap, close to everything (beach, restaurants, my mates house etc).
